title: Sync issue of the mainnet
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2.43.0-stable`

OS & Version: Linux, Amazon Linux 2

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
`erigon --chain=mainnet --ws --http --http.addr=0.0.0.0 --http.api=eth,engine,debug,net,trace,web3,erigon --datadir=/home/ec2-user/erigon_data --internalcl`

Concensus Layer:
With the `--internalctl` flag and nimbus

Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config):
`nimbus_light_client --web3-url=http://127.0.0.1:8551 --jwt-secret=/opt/jwtsecret --trusted-block-root=0x01cbceacbab43fbb3723ec9399e8214887c88e399b477af564876650724aa42e  --tcp-port=9002 --udp-port=9003
User=ec2-user` 

Chain/Network: 
Ethereum mainnet

#### Actual behaviour
The erigon archive node stops sync a few hours later after restart, and it shows the following messages, and query the latest block turns out it falls far away from the latest block. Ever since it falls behind, it keep showing the following message and never sync again.

You are running nimbus but you are using the `--internalcl` flag which tells Erigon to use its own light beacon chain client, and that isn't able to keep up with the chain tip.

So use:
* In Erigon, ~`--externalcl` flag instead~ Don't specify `--internalcl`
* In Erigon, specify a jwtsecret file: `--authrpc.jwtsecret=/tmp/jwtsecret`
* In Nimbus specify the execution layer auth RPC from Erigon: `--el=http://127.0.0.1:8551`
* In Nimbus specify the jwtsecret file, same as Erigon: `--jwt-secret=/tmp/jwtsecret`

Read more in Nimbus docs. Same option applies for nimbus_light_client I think: https://nimbus.guide/eth1.html

> 

Noted with thanks, I have changed the erigon starting commands. I'll keep monitor the node to see if the issue persists.

By the way, for those who are using external beacon chain, the flag `--externalcl` has been removed, please use `--internalcl=false` instead.
--internalcl=false is default, so just leave the flag out if you are using external CL

Is internalcl broken? I'm on devel branch. Is this why my sync / execution keeps restarting?

I'm using `--interalcl=true` and getting `Sentinel Resp context timeout`

> Is internalcl broken? I'm on devel branch. Is this why my sync / execution keeps restarting?
> 
> I'm using `--interalcl=true` and getting `Sentinel Resp context timeout`

(Opinion.) The Erigon internal consensus layer has been in various stages of broken for the past few months. Commonly you are always behind the tip. You should run your own consensus layer node and use `--externalcl` if you want to stay in sync until it gets fixed.
